text: In Italian, (plural: ) is the name for a village or hamlet, which is part of a bigger . Very often, have some infrastructure, such as a school, a post office or a church. Many used to be independent in the past, but over time, several have merged to bigger ones. == In other countries == The name is also used in the Swiss canton Ticino, which is Italian-speaking. In San Marino, frazioni are called curazie. Category:Settlements in Italy Category:San Marino Category:Ticino
title: Frazione
